Allergic rhinitis is a type of type I hypersensitivity reaction.

Type II hypersensitivity reactions are characterized by the production of antibodies (IgG and IgM) against a specific antigen. They also involve the activation of complement and the destruction of cells that display the antigen on their surface.

Spring catarrh does not involve the production of antibodies or the activation of complement. It is a type of type I hypersensitivity reaction, not type II.
